column1: When Varda created the stars in menel
column2: the Elves awakening of the Elves far in the east
column4: a bay in the Inland Sea of Helcar.

column2: Melian wanted to look upon the stars from Taniquetil
Tatyar and Nelyar) long dwelt by the water under stars in wonder and began to make speech
column5: naming themselves the Kwende "those that speak with voices" since they knew no other eloquent things. However they were harassed and captured by spies of the Morgoth who took them to Utumno to the North. They were already scared when Oromë riding Nahar found them in awe.

column1: After the Valar made a War for Sake of the Elves on the Enemy and destroyed his fortress
column2: so that the Children of Ilúvatar live in safety an comfort
column3: Orome took three ambassadors to Valinor
column5: Finwe and Elwe. When they returned

column1: Then befell the first sundering of the Elves. The Minyar and most of the Tatyar were swayed by Orome and decided to follow him. The kindreds of Morwe and Nurwe were Avari and refused the summons
column2: preferring the starlight and the wide spaces of the Earth to the rumour of the Valar.

column1: The Eldar begun the Great March in three hosts. The Minyar were always the most eager for the road. Next the Tatyar
column2: a greater host and then the Nelyar
column4: with two lords: Elwë and his brother Olwë.

column1: As they passed by the Sea of Helcar westwards
column2: they saw great clouds hung still black in the North above the ruins of war. Many of them were scared and turned back.

column1: The journey went slow for the Eldar since Orome frequently departed and then returned to continue the journey. The Eldar were both amazed and tarrying for the nature
column2: and also afraid. Not before after ten Valian years (or a century of coranari) passed
column3: they traversed Mirkwood and reached the Great River that would be called Anduin

column1: When the first two folk already passed the mountains
column2: the Teleri were still by its eastern banks. Terrified by the tall and dangerous peaks
column3: some of the folk of Olwe refused to continue and stayed there. Their leader was Lenwë and they became known as Nandor.

column1: The journey continued in greater pace since by another 10 years
column2: while the Teleri must still have been in Eriador
column3: the Vanyar and Noldor came at length over the Blue Mountains and entered Beleriand. The foremost companies passed over the Vales of Sirion and came to the shores of the Belegaer but still
column4: some Eldar were terrified and withdrew into the woods.

column1: That year Oromë returned to Valinor to seek the counsel of Manwë and left the Eldar alone.

column2: the Teleri came at last to Beleriand and dwelt in the eastward region beyond the River Gelion.

column1: Its possible that by that time
column2: Denethor (Nando) and some of the Nandor decide to continue the journey after all

column1: Ulmo comes and using an island as a ship
column2: takes the Vanyar and the Noldor on it to Valinor
column3: while the Teleri still linger. Some of them were looking for Elwe
column4: who fell in a trance after seeing Melian.

column1: Olwe takes those eager to continue the journey and stay near the sea waiting for Ulmo. In the meantime they are befriended by Osse and Uinen and start to love the sea.
